website_summaries.verdict: Connect 8 devices through a single Thunderbolt cable for well-rounded computing power.
pros: This dock provides lightning-fast speeds of 20 Gbps, supports dual displays, and accommodates 4K cinema resolution
Able to daisy chain 5 total devices together for outstanding peripheral applications
Includes 2 Thunderbolt 2 ports, 3 USB 3.0 ports, 1 HDMI port, 1 Ethernet port, and two audio out ports, one of which supports microphones
cons: HDMI output can be unreliable, and multiple users complained about frustrating customer support

customer_reviews.title: Prepare to constantly disconnect, and reconnect when USB ports turn off due to internal sleep mode.
customer_reviews.text: Pros 1.) Small, and nice design. Cons 1.) Has a sleep mode where USB ports turn off, and won't turn back on unless you disconnect, or power off dock. 2.) Using Firewire adaptors to thunderbolt is undependable. 3.) Does not play well with MacBook pros. Conclusion: Save yourself the headache and get the OWC Thunderbolt 2 Dock which has Firewire built in, and you don't have to keep disconnecting and reconnecting.
customer_reviews.author: Erika B

customer_reviews.title: To be brutally honest, get the OWC Thunderbolt 2 Dock instead
customer_reviews.text: To be brutally honest, get the OWC Thunderbolt 2 Dock instead. Why? It has 5 USB3 ports instead of 3. I have one of each, and I decided to sell the Belkin on Craigslist. Both boxes work perfectly, but those 2 extra USB3 ports come in so handy, it’s no contest. Add to that, the OWC box has 3 USB3 ports in front, and 2 more right around the side closest to the 3 ports, making it very easy to use...
customer_reviews.author: Waikiki

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but effective
customer_reviews.text: This was a hail mary pass to fix my data throughput issues. The Mac Pro just stinks when it comes to port performance, and all USB ports share a single 500 MB backplane. The thunderbolt 2 ports have a hinky arrangement you have to follow or you wind up with collision (what Cisco people call oversubscription). I was pleased this worked out of the box and I was able to add a Drobo direct storage device along with other devices and maintain consistent throughput while mapping the usb to thunderbolt 2 port on the mac.
customer_reviews.author: Bill D

customer_reviews.title: Bought one and it broke within 60 days. Belkin ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought one and it broke within 60 days. Belkin tech support never sent the replacement. I gave up after the sixth phone call.
customer_reviews.author: Homeowner Number 73

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product if you're using MacOS 10 ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product if you're using MacOS 10.12.5 (Sierra) or higher. It's not compatible, and you're throwing your money away. Belkin wants you to buy the Thunderbolt 3, but no one at Belkin or Amazon tells you that.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Stynes

customer_reviews.title: what good is a docking station that doesnt work with a ...
customer_reviews.text: HDMI port didnt work....what good is a docking station that doesnt work with a monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Druva

customer_reviews.title: Crap warranty support
customer_reviews.text: Mine worked great for a while then started flaking out then randomly cutting off which I could fix by cycling power... the random lockups became more more often until it became basically unusable. I spent a painful hour with customer support I really couldn't understand a person's voice...they claimed I'd get a new one and I didn't.
customer_reviews.author: J. Meadlock

customer_reviews.title: POOR DESIGN
customer_reviews.text: Bought this machine in March of 2019. Had to buy VGA to HDMI adaptor in order for the monitor to be compatible with the machine. Got it to work and it lasted one month and 2 weeks. Can't use all of the USB because it would overheat the machine and I would have to unplug it to let cool off then use it again. Customer services is almost nonexistent called 3 times to ask about the overheating issue no answer. DONT BUY GET YOUR SELF SOMETHING CHEAP THAT YOU CAN REPLACE EASILY.
customer_reviews.author: LOUIS RIVERA

customer_reviews.title: Only dual displays if you have a Thunderbolt display - if not an expensive USB 3.0 hub
customer_reviews.text: This is an expensive hub that probably does not do a lot for most users. They advertise this as a hub that can run dual monitors which is why I was interested in purchasing the device. However, I did not see the fine print which states one of those needs to be a thunderbolt display. Well that pretty made this a $230 USB 3.0 hub for me. I have a MBPr 15" So I already had two thunderbolt ports so nothing gained there. I did gain a few extra USB 3.0 ports but at a high price. I have returned the product and ordered a powered USB 3.0 hub ($47). Also, I thought you could daisy chain thunderbolt displays
customer_reviews.author: Dadof3

customer_reviews.title: Great companion to MBP and 34" Dell monitor + peripherals
customer_reviews.text: Using this with 2013 15" MacBook Pro Retina and Dell U3415W. This works flawlessly for my setup, all I have is power and thunderbolt to the MBP, the dock has the other end of the thunderbolt cable, the monitor is running off of mini display coming out of the dock. The dock is full of usb 3.0 hubs and devices as well as Ethernet and speakers in the audio out. Everything works flawlessly, good dock
customer_reviews.author: Lucas S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Using this with my MacBook Air; I purchased so that I’d have more ports to use, also using it to run an external monitor. It works as I expected it too and seems to be high quality, the aluminum matches my MacBook too so it looks nice on my desk
customer_reviews.author: BSW_SC

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: HDMI port disconects, computer recognizes a second screen but there is no output. Already donwloaded drivers, and still doesn't works. Some times you see video output and others nope. Expensive none working product. With a well known brand, BELKIN.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Carpio

customer_reviews.title: Great but still missing something...
customer_reviews.text: 3 external monitors, 1 external hard drive & some other accessories. Although it does the job, it pretty much does the same job as a few external connectors. 1 more thunderbolt and this would of make this a 5 star product.
customer_reviews.author: Gjiro U.

customer_reviews.title: Need a mac monitor in order to use dual monitors.
customer_reviews.text: Biggest flaw is it only supports dual monitors if one of them is a mac monitor (thunderbolt).
customer_reviews.author: HT

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, works good, but a few catches with external displays.
customer_reviews.text: Using with a MacBook Pro Retina driving 2 displays. Only one can be on the thunderbolt port on the dock, the HDMI and Thunderbolt ports did not both work at the same time for a display. That was a bummer because it added back a cable I have to plug in.
customer_reviews.author: JP712

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable HDMI output
customer_reviews.text: Unreliable HDMI output. Connected to a RMBP, the HDMI output had serious defects. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Travel Dork

customer_reviews.title: Special color settings I use on my computer weren't coming ...
customer_reviews.text: Special color settings I use on my computer weren't coming through when I had my monitor connected through this. It also didn't allow my to run my speakers through it. Not sure why there were so many issues.
customer_reviews.author: GeniusUnleashed

customer_reviews.title: Good, clean dock
customer_reviews.text: The overall docking station works well and keeps your desk setup clean. The only downside is that it does not allow for the USB dvd drive to work with my Macbook Pro because it does not power the peripheral through the dock. Other than that, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Mihalsky

customer_reviews.title: Over-Priced Quality
customer_reviews.text: great concept and well made but way over-priced for what it is
customer_reviews.author: Mike Terry

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but nice
customer_reviews.text: Works quite well. It's solved the issue with my external monitor not recognizing that it's been connected to my Macbook. The only minor issue is that headphones hooked up to this don't get any sound. This simplified my need for connecting/disconnecting a backup drive, external monitor, ethernet cable, and USB hub.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Was not able to run multiple screens with either a ...
customer_reviews.text: Was not able to run multiple screens with either a macbook pro or air which is the reason why i bought it
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Pacheco

customer_reviews.title: Better than OWC dock
customer_reviews.text: Stay away from OWC dock. It will fail after 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: AHMED A AL-GHANIM

customer_reviews.title: I guess I received a broken set.. The HDMI port doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: The HDMI port just simply doesn't work.. No matter I plug a HDMI cable itself or with the other cables, never worked! The other ports seem working well. Really disappointed for this purchase...
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Makes connecting a Mac very convenient!
customer_reviews.text: This dock allows for the connection of multiple devices to a Mac with one connection to the Mac. The dock works on both OS X and on Windows 7 in a Boot Camp partition.
customer_reviews.author: SpaceSkier

customer_reviews.title: I used it for my company's Macbook's and it only ...
customer_reviews.text: I used it for my company's Macbook's and it only worked with 1 of the 3 I have. If I plug a monitor in the Thunderbolt slot and Hdmi only one monitor works if I plug into just one slot HDMI or Thunderbolt it works but use both slots only one monitor comes up.
customer_reviews.author: Fresh Diet Admin

customer_reviews.title: It's the real thing!
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast and the product is genuine and when i finished setting up it works the way it should. Great product and Amazon rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Cortejos

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but unit does feel hot after long periods of use.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S. Watts

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was the answer for me for adding additional ports to my 2015 MacBook Air.
customer_reviews.author: BusyGuy

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to my iMac to add devices with reachable ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. A great addition to my iMac to add devices with reachable disconnect.
customer_reviews.author: dred

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all - Don't waste your money or time.
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, arrived faulty, spent all night on line with support, items just doesn't work. Don't waste your money. Go with a OWC thunderbolt. I'll never buy Belkin again. Horrendous customer service, terrible products at a hefty price. Used to think the price was justified now I see they are just chinese junk.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: I do like all of the other features
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a Thunderbolt Hub. This said it had two ports. True but you have to use one of them to connect to your computer. This leaves you only one port... same as what you had already, not much help. I do like all of the other features.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Larsen

customer_reviews.title: I bought this device to connect 2 HDMI monitors to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device to connect 2 HDMI monitors to my MacBook Air. I now realize that this it can't be done. The video promoting the product is inaccurate.
customer_reviews.author: Amardeep

customer_reviews.title: Not practical
customer_reviews.text: It requires a thunderbolt monitor if you want to have more that one external display. It was not a good solution for me.
customer_reviews.author: Georges

customer_reviews.title: very nice device, the only thing is that for a ...
customer_reviews.text: very nice device, the only thing is that for a second screen, a thunderbolt capable monitor is required, in my case I had to buy USB 3.0-VGA Adapter and it works fine, but not fast enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Fuenmayor

customer_reviews.title: Does its job, very well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item so I could make productive use of the Thunderbolt 2 ports on my 2015 iMac. One was already connected to an external hard drive, the other now works with this Dock to connect all sorts of things. The dock feeds USB 3 devices at full speed, gives me a front-facing USB 3 port and headphone / microphone socket, and its matte finish goes well with my iMac's matte aluminum. I've just had it for a few months, but it's given me reliable use, and I've got no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: E. Seale

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a week trying to get this to display two screens and could not make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Whittington

customer_reviews.title: Great dock, performance is solid while adding a lot of connectivity to MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed. Run a MacBook Pro at work and I was always switching drives because its only got two USB ports. Now all of my daily use drives are plugged into the dock with just one Thunderbolt port taken on my laptop so I can plug in another drive or the cd drive or a card reader whenever needed. I haven't noticed any performance fall off either, my drives perform the same with Read/Write tests. It allows me to connect everything in the photo plus another Synology system plus 3 large format Canon printers and my ethernet connection all via one connection to my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor W.

customer_reviews.title: the same connection worked fine through an ethernet-thunderbolt adapter plugged directly into the laptop ...
customer_reviews.text: I will return this item. Ethernet port did not work at all (MacBook Air running 10.9.5, the same connection worked fine through an ethernet-thunderbolt adapter plugged directly into the laptop thunderbolt port). Thunderbolt ports on the Dock are ok, but since one is required to connect to the computer, this is really just a pass-through rather than hub. That really just leaves it as a very overpriced USB hub, which is not what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Gr8 Pyr Mom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent... As Long As You Have At Least One Thunderbolt Display
customer_reviews.text: Does what it claims to do, however I feel the fact that it will only drive two displays as long as one display is a Thunderbolt display falls shy of my expectations. People with two non-Thunderbolt displays that take mini display port or hdmi will be sad to find out that it won't juice them both up. I still have to plug two thunderbolt cables into my macbook pro to run my two desktop screens, one from the Belkin and one still driven from the macbook. It's not their fault I missed that detail and the product performs as advertised. I wish that this detail was more clearly noted almost as a "Warning" label or something.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect with high speed transfere rate in all ports included
customer_reviews.author: elashey

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Exceeded expectations!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect extension of the thunderbolt ports that come standard on the iMac 5k Retina. What's nice about this is you get extra TB ports but you don't have to reach behind the mac to get to them. Cleaned up my cable madness and freed me up to run a second TB hard drive and a 40" 4k second monitor. Only get s four starts because it's pretty expensive.
customer_reviews.author: S C

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The device met my expectations. It works without any problem.
customer_reviews.author: Murat Unalacak

customer_reviews.title: Flawless performance on 2013 Macbook Air
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Even resurrected my Anker USB hub which was not working when plugged directly into a USB port on my 2013 Macbook Air. Got the Belkin dock primarily for home use so that I could connect to my gigabit Ethernet and an external monitor at the same time, plus the convenience of not having to plug/unplug sound-out and multiple USB devices. I was surprised that WireCutter did not include this dock in their recent 2016 roundup of Thunderbolt docks - the stated reason was high cost. However, Belkin has now priced it competitively. It is actually less than the top-ranked dock, and has better features. An improvement over the Thunderbolt 1 dock I use at work.
customer_reviews.author: Biodoc

customer_reviews.title: This piece of gear made it very difficult to work ...
customer_reviews.text: This piece of gear made it very difficult to work. Every time I'd connect, or particularly when I'd wake my Mac up, i'd have to disconnect and reconnect. Sent it back...
customer_reviews.author: Richard Canning

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful connectivity.
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic tool for the connectivity of my professional computer system. I makes the elements all synchronize with the greatest of ease.
customer_reviews.author: Markatekt

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Did not work on my Macbook Air. I bought to use for 2 monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bressi

customer_reviews.title: Broke after three months
customer_reviews.text: It was working great right up until it broke conveniently a few days after the manufacturer warranty ended. I tried calling and did everything I could, but I was out $260. A little steep for a little over 3 months of use in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Nelson

customer_reviews.title: I sure it works. Just not for my computer.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this product works. I bought it as it was the same one in the Apple store and they said it would work. It does not connect to the 2016 MacBook Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Dreamereaper

customer_reviews.title: Thank Belkin for another awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: It's a dock! Love being able to leave everything in one place. This lets me do that. Would like to see a few more USB ports and another display port so I don't have to plug one of my monitors directly into the laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Only Thunderbolt pass-through
customer_reviews.text: Only has Thunderbolt pass-through. We need a hub. Maybe if it was in the description I missed it. Returned
customer_reviews.author: anaxios

customer_reviews.title: Best there is to offer, lacking single connection interface
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sleek and light weight dock. Sadly there are not many options out there for Mac docks. What this one is missing is a simple one connection to your laptop. For someone (cough cough: me) who connects two monitors, power, and Ethernet, everytime I sit down I have to plug in the power, one of my monitors, and then the thunderbolt to the dock. I wish it was like a pc dock where it was one connection for both monitors and the power. Oh well. Maybe they will update it in the future. For now, each time I plug in, I connect 3 connections instead of 6 (2 monitors, Ethernet, power, USB keyboard, thunderbolt for dock)
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Works just as described.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Does what it says! Consolidated multiple cables into a single one, for use with my Macbook Pro. Seems to work without issue. I've had minor quirks with the external display, but that could easily be the display itself. Cons: Nothing major. Might be good to have a way to mount it out-of-sight, but it's not unattractive so that's not a big issue. Other: I'm not a big fan of Belkin, but they got this one right.
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Belkin dock that I have owned. The first one died after several years of daily use. These help keep the connection to your Macbook or iMac clean and simple.
customer_reviews.author: E. Davila

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously great option for connecting multiple devices to my laptop. It is intuitive and I like that. I've tried it with every port in use and it works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Scott E. Herman

customer_reviews.title: Good docking station
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly fine. I used on a 2015 Macbook Pro. and used HDMI to connect to a 27" 1080 display, a USB 3 hard drive and a KVM switch. All worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: S. Chatterjee

customer_reviews.title: USB doesn't work, doesn't support 4K displays
customer_reviews.text: The USB ports on this thing don't work when you plug USB hubs into them. That was why I bought this device in the first place. I found out after the purchase that 4K displays can only be driven at 30Hz, which is unacceptable to anyone who has ever tried it, so that possible use case is out as well. To be fair though, I could have found that out before buying it. It's too big for a paperweight, too, and since I had to travel right after I bought it, I missed the return window as well. It's a hot contender for worst purchase of 2015.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk

customer_reviews.title: HDMI problems
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of problems with the HDMI connection, it would turn off my monitor overtime the laptop went to sleep. With a direct connection, the monitor would just go to sleep when my Mac did. Also, you couldn't turn off the sound from the HDMI, so if I used iTunes it would play through my monitor as well as my bluetooth speakers. For me, the eSATA and DP ports were just a waste of space which could have been used for more USB 3.0 ports.
customer_reviews.author: CS Dee

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for my Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase for my Macbook Pro, turned my CPU into a massive hub for all connections (USB, HDMI and Thunderbolt)
customer_reviews.author: Revitalized Electronics

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Quality, but I gave 4 stars because I haven't gotten my 4k monitor to work through it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Using as a condiut for three monitors, several usb drives and an ilok 2. Two weeks in and no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Darin Dipietro

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great products, make my desk looks more nice, will be great have more USB ports, on the back side.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Works with a MacBook Pro.
customer_reviews.text: Works only with a Mac but not with a windows 10 computer.
customer_reviews.author: Julian B.

customer_reviews.title: Upon receiving this device I was very disappointed by the real world experience of using this dock
customer_reviews.text: Upon receiving this device I was very disappointed by the real world experience of using this dock. I use it at work with my 15" MacBook Pro, and effectively it feels like a very expensive USB hub. Originally I had thought it would alter my experience setting up for the day, but with the hdmi or miniport limitation all I've managed to do is switch a thunderbolt Ethernet cable, mini display connection and usb hub for an hdmi connection and a thunderbolt cable. For the price Id hoped for a dock experience that was better than a jumble of cables, and I ended up with a smaller jumble of cables and a $300 bill.
customer_reviews.author: Marsupermammal

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The product's HDMI port does not work properly with my LCD screen.
customer_reviews.author: henry a baez

customer_reviews.title: Works great with 2014 MacBook Pro Retina and two external monitors
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this dock to cut down on the number of cables plugged into my MacBookPro Retina laptop when I transition from work to the home office. The dock worked flawlessly, and I only have to connect power and the Thunderbolt cable when I move locations. I'm using this with a USB 3.0 to HDMI video chipset adapter, and moving between the laptop display and two 27 inch displays had been painless and trouble-free. No issues recovering the I/O after the laptop sleeps - both external monitors come on as soon as the laptop display wakes up. Very happy with my choice, although the dock is pricy at $299.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of equipment, ports for everything. A bit pricey but worth it to me!
customer_reviews.author: William L. English

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Work as it should! Just make sure you get good cables
customer_reviews.author: Rui Teixeira

customer_reviews.title: The bundle thunderbolt cable is a good move from the first generation
customer_reviews.text: Most of the ports are connected and seems working perfectly as a build-in one of the MacBook Pro. The bundle thunderbolt cable is a good move from the first generation.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Tang

customer_reviews.title: Has work as expected. Used as a doc for ...
customer_reviews.text: Has work as expected. Used as a doc for my Mac Book Air using a mini-display connecter for second monitor along with the ethernet and usb ports.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Peterson

customer_reviews.title: This was a present for my son and per his ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for my son and per his comments: He is using at his office instead of home. As many people he is frequently going to meetings with his Macbook Pro retina. This means unplugging monitor, keyboard, charging cords, speakers ... He said frequently when coming back and reconnecting everything something does not connect without some type of attention. Now with the Belkin dock, that headache is a thing of the past. Reconnection is a the power and thunderbolt only.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: This does not charge and wasn't what I thought it was.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really as simple as plug-and-play
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my 2012 Retina MacBook Pro, which only has Thunderbolt 1. I have multiple USB 3.0 drives, a thunderbolt SSD, and an HDMI monitor connected to this thing and have had no issues over the few weeks I've had it. Closest thing to a real docking station I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Sandip Chatterjee

customer_reviews.title: works great! I wish there were 2 more USB ports
customer_reviews.text: works great! I wish there were 2 more USB ports though
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid operation
customer_reviews.text: Product works as advertised. My previous Elgato dock had problems keeping USB devices connected. This dock is rock solid. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: art

customer_reviews.title: The performance is great as it takes full advantage of Thunderbolt 2
customer_reviews.text: Manages all our Macbook Pro devices (external Drives - USB 3.0 and monitor) with only one cable connected to the MAC. You can connect and disconnect the laptop without interruptions. The performance is great as it takes full advantage of Thunderbolt 2
customer_reviews.author: Michel Rochon

customer_reviews.title: It's really great!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! This product I am looking for a long time, and today I received in Taiwan. in same type of product comparison, it's really great!
customer_reviews.author: Anson

product_meta.title: Belkin Thunderbolt 2 Express HD Dock with 1-Meter Thunderbolt Data Transfer Cable, Mac and PC Compatible (F4U085tt)
product_meta.description: Style:Thunderbolt 2Connect your laptop and other devices to the Thunderbolt 2 Express Dock HD for lightning-fast file transfers. Operating at 20 Gbps, the connection lets you transfer music, movies, and other data files at twice the speed of the previous Thunderbolt. Connect up to eight devices to your laptop using the included cable, keeping your workspace organized and streamlining your setup. Dual-display compatibility lets you attach two additional monitors to your laptop, and the dock supports vivid 4K cinema resolution on one display. The slim, low-profile design won't monopolize space on your desk. Compatibility:MacBook Air 11 inch,MacBook Air 13 inch,MacBook Pro (2014),MacBook Pro 13 inch, MacBook Pro 15 inc, MacBook Pro 17 inch
feature_bullets: Transfers files at 20 Gbps with Thunderbolt 2 technology
4x faster than USB 3.0 and 25x faster than FireWire 800
Connect 8 separate devices through a single Thunderbolt cable, and daisy chain up to 4 more Thunderbolt devices (5 total)
Keeps your workspace organized and your setup streamlined
Ultra sleek, lightweight design with brushed aluminum body. Requires Mac OS X v10.9 or later, or Windows 7 or 8
The Belkin Thunderbolt Dock includes three USB 3 ports, two Thunderbolt 2 ports, HDMI, Ethernet, audio out port, and additional audio out port with mic support

Note about dual displays: At least one display has to be Thunderbolt or Thunderbolt 2 technology-ready. For displays that are not Thunderbolt technology-ready, the Thunderbolt port is backwards compatible with Mini DisplayPort. The dock supports either HDMI or Mini DisplayPort, but not both. The dock supports only one display at 4K cinema resolution

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars194 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
